models.name: AuditStamp
models.doc: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

fields.name: time

type.name: Time
type.doc: Number of milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. It must be a positive number

fields.doc: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

fields.name: actor
fields.doc: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

fields.name: impersonator
fields.doc: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

models.name: ChangeAuditStamps
models.doc: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into various lifecycle stages, and who acted to move it into those lifecycle stages. The recommended best practice is to include this record in your record schema, and annotate its fields as @readOnly in your resource. See https://github.com/linkedin/rest.li/wiki/Validation-in-Rest.li#restli-validation-annotations

fields.name: created
fields.doc: An AuditStamp corresponding to the creation of this resource/association/sub-resource

fields.name: lastModified
fields.doc: An AuditStamp corresponding to the last modification of this resource/association/sub-resource. If no modification has happened since creation, lastModified should be the same as created

fields.name: deleted
fields.doc: An AuditStamp corresponding to the deletion of this resource/association/sub-resource. Logically, deleted MUST have a later timestamp than creation. It may or may not have the same time as lastModified depending upon the resource/association/sub-resource semantics.

models.name: DataPlatformUrn
models.doc: Standardized data platforms available

fields.doc: data platform name i.e. hdfs, oracle, espresso
fields.name: platformName

models.name: DatasetUrn
models.doc: Standardized dataset identifier.

fields.doc: Standardized platform urn where dataset is defined.
fields.name: platform

fields.doc: Dataset native name e.g. <db>.<table>, /dir/subdir/<name>, or <name>
fields.name: datasetName

fields.doc: Fabric type where dataset belongs to or where it was generated.
fields.name: origin

models.name: FabricType
models.doc: Fabric group type

models.name: InstitutionalMemory
models.doc: Institutional memory of an entity. This is a way to link to relevant documentation and provide description of the documentation. Institutional or tribal knowledge is very important for users to leverage the entity.

fields.name: elements

items.name: InstitutionalMemoryMetadata
items.doc: Metadata corresponding to a record of institutional memory.

fields.name: url
fields.doc: Link to an engineering design document or a wiki page.

fields.name: description
fields.doc: Description of the link.

fields.name: createStamp
fields.doc: Audit stamp associated with creation of this record
List of records that represent institutional memory of an entity. Each record consists of a link, description, creator and timestamps associated with that record.

models.name: Owner
models.doc: Ownership information

fields.name: owner
fields.doc: Owner URN, e.g. urn:li:corpuser:ldap, urn:li:corpGroup:group_name, and urn:li:multiProduct:mp_name

fields.name: type

type.name: OwnershipType
type.doc: Owner category or owner role

symbolDocs.CONSUMER: A person, group, or service that consumes the data
symbolDocs.DATAOWNER: A person or group that is owning the data
symbolDocs.DELEGATE: A person or a group that overseas the operation, e.g. a DBA or SRE.
symbolDocs.DEVELOPER: A person or group that is in charge of developing the code
symbolDocs.PRODUCER: A person, group, or service that produces/generates the data
symbolDocs.STAKEHOLDER: A person or a group that has direct business interest

fields.doc: The type of the ownership

fields.name: source

type.name: OwnershipSource
type.doc: Source/provider of the ownership information

fields.name: type

symbolDocs.SERVICE: Other ownership-like service, e.g. Nuage, ACL service etc

fields.doc: The type of the source

fields.name: url
fields.doc: A reference URL for the source
Source information for the ownership

models.name: Ownership
models.doc: Ownership information of an entity.

fields.name: owners
fields.doc: List of owners of the entity.

fields.name: lastModified
fields.doc: Audit stamp containing who last modified the record and when.

models.name: Status
models.doc: The status metadata of an entity, e.g. dataset, metric, feature, etc.

fields.name: removed
fields.doc: whether the entity is removed or not

models.name: VersionTag
models.doc: A resource-defined string representing the resource state for the purpose of concurrency control

models.name: Dataset
models.doc: Dataset spec for a data store. A collection of data conforming to a single schema that can evolve over time. This is equivalent to a Table in most data platforms. Espresso dataset: Identity.Profile; oracle dataset: member2.member_profile; hdfs dataset: /data/databases/JOBS/JOB_APPLICATIONS; kafka: PageViewEvent

fields.name: platform
fields.doc: Standardized platform urn where dataset is defined. The data platform Urn (urn:li:platform:{platform_name})

fields.name: name
fields.doc: Dataset native name e.g. {db}.{table}, /dir/subdir/{name}, or {name}

fields.name: origin
fields.doc: Fabric type where dataset belongs to or where it was generated.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: Dataset unique identifier. System assigned value when a new dataset is created.

fields.name: urn
fields.doc: Dataset urn

fields.name: description
fields.doc: Description for dataset

fields.name: platformNativeType
fields.doc: The native format for the data platform

fields.name: uri
fields.doc: The abstracted such as hdfs:///data/tracking/PageViewEvent, file:///dir/file_name. Uri should not include any environment specific properties. Some datasets might not have a standardized uri, which makes this field optional (i.e. kafka topic).

fields.name: tags
fields.doc: tags for searching dataset

fields.name: properties
fields.doc: A key-value map of platform-specific properties

fields.name: removed
fields.doc: whether the dataset is removed or not

fields.name: deprecation

type.name: DatasetDeprecation
type.doc: Dataset deprecation status

fields.name: deprecated
fields.doc: Whether the dataset is deprecated by owner.

fields.name: decommissionTime
fields.doc: The time user plan to decommission this dataset.

fields.name: note
fields.doc: Additional information about the dataset deprecation plan, such as the wiki, doc, RB.

fields.name: actor
fields.doc: The corpuser URN which will be credited for modifying this deprecation content.
The dataset deprecation status

fields.name: institutionalMemory
fields.doc: Institutional memory metadata of the dataset

fields.name: ownership
fields.doc: Ownership metadata of the dataset

fields.name: schemaMetadata

type.name: SchemaMetadata
type.doc: SchemaMetadata to describe metadata related to store schema

fields.name: schemaName
fields.doc: Schema name e.g. PageViewEvent, identity.Profile, ams.account_management_tracking

fields.name: platform
fields.doc: Standardized platform urn where schema is defined. The data platform Urn (urn:li:platform:{platform_name})

fields.name: version
fields.doc: Every change to SchemaMetadata in the resource results in a new version. Version is server assigned. This version is differ from platform native schema version.

fields.name: dataset
fields.doc: Dataset this schema metadata is associated with.

fields.name: cluster
fields.doc: The cluster this schema metadata resides from

fields.name: hash
fields.doc: the SHA1 hash of the schema content

fields.name: platformSchema

type.name: EspressoSchema
type.doc: Schema text of an espresso table schema.

fields.name: documentSchema
fields.doc: The native espresso document schema.

fields.name: tableSchema
fields.doc: The espresso table schema definition.

type.name: OracleDDL
type.doc: Schema holder for oracle data definition language that describes an oracle table.

fields.name: tableSchema
fields.doc: The native schema in the dataset's platform. This is a human readable (json blob) table schema.

type.name: MySqlDDL
type.doc: Schema holder for MySql data definition language that describes an MySql table.

fields.name: tableSchema
fields.doc: The native schema in the dataset's platform. This is a human readable (json blob) table schema.

type.name: PrestoDDL
type.doc: Schema holder for presto data definition language that describes a presto view.

fields.name: rawSchema
fields.doc: The raw schema in the dataset's platform. This includes the DDL and the columns extracted from DDL.

type.name: KafkaSchema
type.doc: Schema holder for kafka schema.

fields.name: documentSchema
fields.doc: The native kafka document schema. This is a human readable avro document schema.

type.name: BinaryJsonSchema
type.doc: Schema text of binary JSON schema.

fields.name: schema
fields.doc: The native schema text for binary JSON file format.

type.name: OrcSchema
type.doc: Schema text of an ORC schema.

fields.name: schema
fields.doc: The native schema for ORC file format.

type.name: Schemaless
type.doc: The dataset has no specific schema associated with it

type.name: KeyValueSchema
type.doc: Schema text of a key-value store schema.

fields.name: keySchema
fields.doc: The raw schema for the key in the key-value store.

fields.name: valueSchema
fields.doc: The raw schema for the value in the key-value store.

type.name: OtherSchema
type.doc: Schema holder for undefined schema types.

fields.name: rawSchema
fields.doc: The native schema in the dataset's platform.
The native schema in the dataset's platform.

fields.name: fields

items.name: SchemaField
items.doc: SchemaField to describe metadata related to dataset schema. Schema normalization rules: http://go/tms-schema

fields.name: fieldPath

type.name: SchemaFieldPath
type.doc: Schema field path as described by schema normalizations rules: http://go/tms-schema

fields.doc: Flattened name of the field. Field is computed from jsonPath field. For data translation rules refer to wiki page above.

fields.name: jsonPath
fields.doc: Flattened name of a field in JSON Path notation.

fields.name: nullable
fields.doc: Indicates if this field is optional or nullable

fields.name: description
fields.doc: Description

fields.name: type

type.name: SchemaFieldDataType
type.doc: Schema field data types

fields.name: type

type.name: BooleanType
type.doc: Boolean field type.

type.name: FixedType
type.doc: Fixed field type.

type.name: StringType
type.doc: String field type.

type.name: BytesType
type.doc: Bytes field type.

type.name: NumberType
type.doc: Number data type: long, integer, short, etc..

type.name: EnumType
type.doc: Enum field type.

type.name: NullType
type.doc: Null field type.

type.name: MapType
type.doc: Map field type.

fields.name: keyType
fields.doc: Key type in a map

fields.name: valueType
fields.doc: Type of the value in a map

type.name: ArrayType
type.doc: Array field type.

fields.name: nestedType
fields.doc: List of types this array holds.

type.name: UnionType
type.doc: Union field type.

fields.name: nestedTypes
fields.doc: List of types in union type.

type.name: RecordType
type.doc: Record field type.

fields.doc: Data platform specific types
Platform independent field type of the field.

fields.name: nativeDataType
fields.doc: The native type of the field in the dataset's platform as declared by platform schema.

fields.name: recursive
fields.doc: There are use cases when a field in type B references type A. A field in A references field of type B. In such cases, we will mark the first field as recursive.
Client provided a list of fields from document schema.

fields.name: primaryKeys
fields.doc: Client provided list of fields that define primary keys to access record. Field order defines hierarchical espresso keys. Empty lists indicates absence of primary key access patter. Value is a SchemaField@fieldPath.

fields.name: foreignKeysSpecs

values.name: ForeignKeySpec
values.doc: Description of a foreign key in a schema.

fields.name: foreignKey

type.name: DatasetFieldForeignKey
type.doc: For non-urn based foregin keys.

fields.name: parentDataset
fields.doc: dataset that stores the resource.

fields.name: currentFieldPaths
fields.doc: List of fields in hosting(current) SchemaMetadata that conform a foreign key. List can contain a single entry or multiple entries if several entries in hosting schema conform a foreign key in a single parent dataset.

fields.name: parentField
fields.doc: SchemaField@fieldPath that uniquely identify field in parent dataset that this field references.

type.name: UrnForeignKey
type.doc: If SchemaMetadata fields make any external references and references are of type com.linkeidn.common.Urn or any children, this models can be used to mark it.

fields.name: currentFieldPath
fields.doc: Field in hosting(current) SchemaMetadata.
Foreign key definition in metadata schema.
Map captures all the references schema makes to external datasets. Map key is ForeignKeySpecName typeref.
Schema metadata of the dataset

fields.name: status
fields.doc: Status metadata of the dataset

fields.name: upstreamLineage

type.name: UpstreamLineage
type.doc: Upstream lineage of a dataset

fields.name: upstreams

items.name: Upstream
items.doc: Upstream lineage information about a dataset including the source reporting the lineage

fields.name: auditStamp
fields.doc: Audit stamp containing who reported the lineage and when

fields.name: dataset
fields.doc: The upstream dataset the lineage points to

fields.name: type

type.name: DatasetLineageType
type.doc: The various types of supported dataset lineage

symbolDocs.TRANSFORMED: Transformed data with modification (format or content change)
symbolDocs.VIEW: Represents a view defined on the sources e.g. Hive view defined on underlying hive tables or a Hive table pointing to a HDFS dataset or DALI view defined on multiple sources

fields.doc: The type of the lineage
List of upstream dataset lineage information
Upstream lineage metadata of the dataset

models.name: DatasetProperties
models.doc: Properties associated with a Dataset

fields.name: description
fields.doc: Documentation of the dataset

fields.name: uri
fields.doc: The abstracted URI such as hdfs:///data/tracking/PageViewEvent, file:///dir/file_name. Uri should not include any environment specific properties. Some datasets might not have a standardized uri, which makes this field optional (i.e. kafka topic).

fields.name: tags
fields.doc: tags for the dataset

fields.name: customProperties
fields.doc: A key-value map to capture any other non-standardized properties for the dataset

models.name: Downstream
models.doc: Downstream lineage information about a dataset including the source reporting the lineage

fields.name: auditStamp
fields.doc: Audit stamp containing who reported the lineage and when

fields.name: dataset
fields.doc: The downstream dataset the lineage points to

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The type of the lineage

models.name: DownstreamLineage
models.doc: Downstream lineage of a dataset

fields.name: downstreams
fields.doc: List of downstream dataset lineage information

models.name: UpstreamLineageDelta
models.doc: Describes a delta change to a dataset upstream lineage

fields.name: upstreamsToUpdate
fields.doc: The list of upstream lineages to be updated for a dataset

models.name: DatasetAspect
models.doc: A union of all supported metadata aspects for a Dataset

fields.name: name
fields.doc: The name of the aggregation, e.g, platform, origin

fields.name: aggregations
fields.doc: List of aggregations showing the number of documents falling into each bucket. e.g, for platform aggregation, the bucket can be hive, kafka, etc

models.name: AutoCompleteResult
models.doc: The model for the auto complete result

fields.name: query
fields.doc: The original chars typed by user

fields.name: suggestions
fields.doc: A list of typeahead suggestions

models.name: BrowseResult
models.doc: The model for the result of a browse query

fields.name: entities

items.name: BrowseResultEntity
items.doc: Data model for an entity returned as part of a browse query

fields.name: name
fields.doc: Name of the entity

fields.name: urn
fields.doc: URN of the entity
A list of entities under the queried path

fields.name: metadata

type.name: BrowseResultMetadata
type.doc: The model for browse result metadata

fields.name: path
fields.doc: Path that is being browsed

fields.name: groups
name
fields.doc: Name of the group

fields.name: count
fields.doc: Number of entities that can be reached from this path
A list of groups and total number of entities inside those groups under the queried path

fields.name: totalNumEntities
fields.doc: Total number of entities we can reach from path
Metadata specific to the browse result of the queried path

fields.name: from
fields.doc: Offset of the first entity in the result

fields.name: pageSize
fields.doc: Size of each page in the result

fields.name: numEntities
fields.doc: The total number of entities directly under queried path

models.name: Condition
models.doc: The matching condition in a filter criterion

symbolDocs.CONTAIN: Represent the relation: String field contains value, e.g. name contains Profile
symbolDocs.END_WITH: Represent the relation: String field ends with value, e.g. name ends with Event
symbolDocs.EQUAL: Represent the relation: field = value, e.g. platform = hdfs
symbolDocs.GREATER_THAN: Represent the relation greater than, e.g. ownerCount > 5
symbolDocs.GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Represent the relation greater than or equal to, e.g. ownerCount >= 5
symbolDocs.LESS_THAN: Represent the relation less than, e.g. ownerCount < 3
symbolDocs.LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Represent the relation less than or equal to, e.g. ownerCount <= 3
symbolDocs.START_WITH: Represent the relation: String field starts with value, e.g. name starts with PageView

models.name: Criterion
models.doc: A criterion for matching a field with given value

fields.name: field
fields.doc: The name of the field that the criterion refers to

fields.name: value
fields.doc: The value of the intended field

fields.name: condition
fields.doc: The condition for the criterion, e.g. EQUAL, START_WITH

models.name: Filter
models.doc: The filter for finding an record or a collection of records

fields.name: criteria
fields.doc: A list of criteria the filter applies to the query

models.name: SearchResultMetadata
models.doc: The model for the search result

fields.name: searchResultMetadatas
fields.doc: A list of search result metadata such as aggregations

fields.name: urns
fields.doc: A list of urns corresponding to search documents (in order) as returned by the search index

models.name: SortCriterion
models.doc: Sort order along with the field to sort it on, to be applied to the results.

fields.name: field
fields.doc: The name of the field that sorting has to be applied to

fields.name: order

type.name: SortOrder
type.doc: The order used to sort the results

symbolDocs.ASCENDING: If results need to be sorted in ascending order
symbolDocs.DESCENDING: If results need to be sorted in descending order

fields.doc: The order to sort the results i.e. ASCENDING or DESCENDING

models.name: BackfillResult
models.doc: The model for the result of a backfill

fields.name: entities
urn
fields.doc: Urn of the backfilled entity

fields.name: aspects
fields.doc: List of the aspects backfilled for the entity
List of backfilled entities

models.name: DatasetSnapshot
models.doc: A metadata snapshot for a specific dataset entity.

fields.name: urn
fields.doc: URN for the entity the metadata snapshot is associated with.

fields.name: aspects
fields.doc: The list of metadata aspects associated with the dataset. Depending on the use case, this can either be all, or a selection, of supported aspects.

models.name: EmptyRecord
models.doc: An literally empty record.  Intended as a marker to indicate the absence of content where a record type is required.  If used the underlying DataMap *must* be empty, EmptyRecordValidator is provided to help enforce this.  For example,  CreateRequest extends Request<EmptyRecord> to indicate it has no response body.   Also, a ComplexKeyResource implementation that has no ParamKey should have a signature like XyzResource implements ComplexKeyResource<XyzKey, EmptyRecord, Xyz>.
